intro: Smilax pallescens, commonly known as the pale smilax, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Smilacaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny growth. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and have a rough texture. Smilax pallescens is often found in moist woodlands and is known for its ability to climb or trail along the ground.
